oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Ensign Alexander Jefferson Carver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ensign Alexander Jefferson Carver, Co. F, 45th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Carver was from Wilson County, Tennessee from the area near the Hermitge. Carver is in a post-war reunion uniform with reunion badges. He served in the color guard until June 1864 and; then as the color bearer. He was wounded at Chickamauga, New Hope and Jonesboro, Georgia, where he lost his arm. He is buried at the Confederate Circle at Mount Olivet Cemetery in Nashville, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Carver, Alexander Jefferson
